intro: Astragalus tribuloides var. platycarpus, commonly known as the broad-fruited milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as sagebrush steppe and open woodlands. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces yellow or pale yellow flowers in late spring. Its fruit is a pod that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. It is valued for its role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
